title: How was the Battle of Haldighati started? - Quora

response.answer_text: The Battle was long in preparing. Akbar sent an Army under Man Singh of Amer (remember Amer was subordinate to Mewar under Rana Sanga, Pratap’s grandfather; a subtle message). They already had captured the plains area of Mewar, including the Forts of Chittor and Mandalgarh. Now after a thorough preparation the Mughal Army moved into the heart of Mewar, the hill area, with the objective of capturing Gogunda. The entrance to the hills was guarded by the pass of Haldighati. Pratap’s army was concentrated behind the Pass, which was guarded by the Bhils. As the Mughal Army moved up after crossing the Banas River, the Maharana started moving up too. The trigger for the Mewar attack was when Mughal Army cannons started crossing the River.

When maharana Pratap came on the throne àkbar sent 6 expeditions to convince maharana Pratap in front of àkbar but àkbar s diplomats could not convince maharana Pratap to subdue so àkbar started preparations to fight decisive war at haldighati battle of haldighati started on 18th June 1576 and Mewar army fought the battle after maharana Pratap left the battlefield after being wounded
